conclusion: Analyze the motion of particles in the particle accelerator M and velocity selector N.
Determine velocity v of the first particle after acceleration in M using kinetic energy equation.
Velocity v of the first particle is v = sqrt(2qU/m).
In velocity selector N, electric field E and magnetic field B are perpendicular.
For no deflection, electric force must balance magnetic force: qE = qvB.
Electric field E is E = vB.
Substitute v to get E = B sqrt(2qU/m).
Determine velocity v' of the second particle after acceleration in M.
Velocity v' of the second particle is v' = sqrt(qU/m).
Calculate electric force F_E for the second particle: F_E = qE = qB sqrt(2qU/m).
Calculate magnetic force F_B for the second particle: F_B = qv'B = qB sqrt(qU/m).
Since F_E != F_B, the second particle will be deflected.
Net force on the second particle is F_net = qB sqrt(qU/m) (sqrt(2) - 1).
Kinetic energy E_k of the second particle is determined by its velocity v'.
Kinetic energy E_k = qU for the second particle when it leaves N.
